definition:
Let $\rho :G\to K$ be a group homomorphism. The preimage of the codomain
identity element $e_K\in K$ forms a subgroup of the domain $G$, called
the *kernel* of the homomorphism;
$$\operatorname{ker}(\rho)= \{ s \in G\mid\rho   (s)=e_K\}$$

The kernel is a normal subgroup. It is the trivial subgroup if and only
if $\rho$ is a monomorphism.
